definition: to moisten/to dampen/to be steeped in/to be imbued with
to moisten/to be infected by/to receive benefit or advantage through a contact/to touch

sentences.english: Her cheeks were bedewed with tears.
sentences.chinese: 她的双颊被泪水沾湿了。

sentences.english: Originally the phrase means two fish out of water moisten each other with saliva to keep each other alive temporarily.
sentences.chinese: 原指离开水的鱼相互吐沫沾湿，以求得暂时的生存。

sentences.english: Do not touch the wet hand with power plugs.
sentences.chinese: 请勿用沾湿的手拔电源线插头。

sentences.english: Spread contents of sachet on cleansed and slightly wet skin.
sentences.chinese: 将液体状面膜涂抹在清洁并稍微沾湿的皮肤。

sentences.english: The sky was like a sheet of drawing paper that has being dampened then showered with powdered graphite.
sentences.chinese: 天空看起来像一张被沾湿，之后撒上石墨的纸。

sentences.english: Has the excellent jointing character, bedewed character can be put up in different parts.
sentences.chinese: 拥用极佳焊接性，可在不同部位表现出适当的沾湿性。

sentences.english: Obama's tear-stained cheeks, a tear streams down his cheek.
sentences.chinese: 奥巴马泪水沾湿的脸颊，一滴眼泪顺着脸颊流下。

sentences.english: Wet the edges of the skin.
She had risen, as the nurse said, and the lashes of her eyes were wet with tears.
sentences.chinese: 这位奶妈说，她起来了，眼睫毛都被泪水沾湿了。

sentences.english: Elder brother, I was drenched and released agreeable?You bedewed to have to be sick.
sentences.chinese: 哥哥，我淋了雨，放开好吗？你沾湿了要生病的。

definition: water spot/water stain/wet spot/damp patch/water damage
